value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: Conditionally replace values in Power Query in one step
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to conditional replace values in one step without adding new columns in Power Query, Enjoy!! value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, I’ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Getting Started with Dataflow in Microsoft Fabric Data Factory
value.excerpt: The Dataflow in Microsoft Fabric is an element for getting the data from the source, transforming it, and loading it into a destination. In this article and video, we will go through what Dataflow is and how it works with a simple example of it. Learn more from my article here: https://radacad.com/getting-started-with-dataflow-in-microsoft-fabric-data-factory
